q: Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.
h:
“Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.” —
Bob Marley

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
h:
“Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The significance of life is living.
h:
“The significance of life is living.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
h:
“Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.” —
Socrates

q: There are no mistakes in life, only lessons.
h:
“There are no mistakes in life, only lessons.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
h:
“Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.” —
Samuel Butler

q: You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.
h:
“You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.” —
Les Brown

q: There's more to life than being a passenger.
h:
“There's more to life than being a passenger.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
h:
“The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.” —
Alfred Adler

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.
h:
“Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well. ” —
Jack London

q: Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
h:
“Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.
h:
“Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.
h:
“Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Attitude drives actions. Actions drive results. Results drive lifestyles.
h:
“Attitude drives actions. Actions drive results. Results drive lifestyles.” —
Jim Rohn

q: A life without a cause is a life without effect.
h:
“A life without a cause is a life without effect.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.
h:
“Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
h:
“Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.” —
Carol Burnett

q: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace by avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Life has the name of life, but in reality it is death.
h:
“Life has the name of life, but in reality it is death.” —
Heraclitus

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
h:
“Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.” —
Carol Burnett

q: True life is lived when tiny changes occur.
h:
“True life is lived when tiny changes occur.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
h:
“The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.” —
Carl Jung

q: Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.
h:
“Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.
h:
“Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make, the better.
h:
“All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make, the better.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.
h:
“The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.” —
Alan Watts

q: If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.
h:
“If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Life happens in the river, not the shore.
h:
“Life happens in the river, not the shore.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
h:
“Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.” —
Og Mandino

q: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
h:
“My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.” —
Steve Jobs

q: We meet ourselves time and again in a thousand disguises on the path of life.
h:
“We meet ourselves time and again in a thousand disguises on the path of life.” —
Carl Jung

q: Life must be a constant education; one must learn everything, from speaking to dying.
h:
“Life must be a constant education; one must learn everything, from speaking to dying.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.
h:
“Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.
h:
“Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Life is a journey, not a destination.
h:
“Life is a journey, not a destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: Life is a constant series of opportunities.
h:
“Life is a constant series of opportunities.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.
h:
“If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
h:
“Do every act of your life as if it were your last.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: We cannot always do great things in life, but we can do small things with great love.
h:
“We cannot always do great things in life, but we can do small things with great love.” —
Dan Millman

q: The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
h:
“The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.” —
Confucius

q: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
h:
“You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
h:
“If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
h:
“Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.
h:
“Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Contemplation often makes life miserable.  We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.
h:
“Contemplation often makes life miserable. We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.” —
Nicolas Chamfort
